poem:
**Innocence on Trial**

In morning light, the children play,  
bearing banners not of their own make.  
Their laughter, caught in crossfire,  
while grown-ups draw their lines in sand.  
So vast the storm for such small ships,  
yet here they stand,  
gazing up, paper sailboats,  
in quiet defiance,  
unwilling to sink.
